sections.header: Plea and trial preparation hearing form
sections.label: The pre-hearing information form must be completed by the parties for all cases sent to the Crown Court where a trial is expected unless the case is expressly exempted by the CrimPR or CrimPD.
sections.defendants: D1 Crime Inc, D2 Mollie CONN

fields.label: Summary of circumstances of the offence(s) and of any account given by defendant(s) in interview (this may be in Form MG5)

sections.youngVulnerableIntimidatedTitle: Young/Vulnerable/Intimidated Defendants - measures to assist that can be granted at PTPH
sections.youngVulnerableIntimidatedFooter: The Court is required to give reasons for departing from the relevant provisions of the CrimPD - See CrimPD | 3D-3G and 3N; CrimPD V18A-B - R v Grant-Morris (2017] EWCA Crim 1228 and the Equal Treatment Bench Book

fields.label: During court proceedings the defendant is to be referred to as
Measures that can be granted at PTPH without formal application
fields.hintText: CrimPD 3C-3G\nThese measures apply to pre-trial hearings as appropriate

fields.label: Severance - Where the defendant appears alongside a defendant who is not vulnerable
Non-trial hearings - suitability of video link
Measures to assist the defendant to give evidence
fields.hintText: CrimPD V 18\nIf the defendant seeks additional special measures such as the use of live link (with or without pre-trial practice) or screens to give evidence, or to have a supporter (other than an intermediary) in the live-link room or to sit near the defendant during evidence or other special measure then a formal application will be required at Stage 2

fields.label: Has the Judge given an oral judgement on the measures required?
During court proceedings the defendant is to be referred to as
Measures that can be granted at PTPH without formal application
fields.hintText: CrimPD 3C-3G\nThese measures apply to pre-trial hearings as appropriate

fields.label: Severance - Where the defendant appears alongside a defendant who is not vulnerable
Non-trial hearings - suitability of video link
Measures to assist the defendant to give evidence
fields.hintText: CrimPD V 18\nIf the defendant seeks additional special measures such as the use of live link (with or without pre-trial practice) or screens to give evidence, or to have a supporter (other than an intermediary) in the live-link room or to sit near the defendant during evidence or other special measure then a formal application will be required at Stage 2

fields.label: Has the Judge given an oral judgement on the measures required?
Pleas entered at PTPH or reason if not arraigned
Add further details about estimate if necessary
Certification of trial readiness status to be completed by all parties
fields.hintText: (If no date is inserted then to be 28 days before trial date)

subSections.heading: Stage 1
subSections.hintText: Ordinarily 50 days (custody cases) or 70 days (bail cases) after sending.

fields.label: Unless individual dates are provided the prosecution shall serve the following by:
Service of prosecution case to include making available ABE transcripts and recordings relied on
Updated or initial Disclosure Management Document - to address issues raised by defence on the PTPH form
Multi-media evidence (inc. CCTV and BWV) relied upon as part of the prosecution case
Written record of defendant's taped interview (ROTI).
fields.hintText: Parties are required to engage pre-trial to agree a summary or editing. Where there is a substantially interview a short summary rather than a full transcript is sufficient unless otherwise ordered. Audio recording of defendant's interviews to be obtained from investigator if required by defence

fields.label: 999 call transcript(s) and recording(s) if relied upon as part of the prosecution case
Telephone, cell site, or other social media records relied if relied on as part of the prosecution case.
Telephone, cell site, social media, and/or timeline analysis
Forensic statements (SFR 2 or MG11) that can be served by Stage 1.
fields.hintText: This order only applies where, in relation to SFR1 (or other served summary of expert's conclusions), the defendant has identified on the PTPH form a conclusion that is not admitted and what the disputed issues are.  The SFR2 or MG11 will be limited to those identified issues

fields.label: Bad character notice(s) with supporting evidence relied on
Unless individual dates are provided the prosecution shall comply with the orders below by:
The following areas of third party material have been identified

Prosecution shall either make requests to third party and if necessary apply for third party disclosure summonses, OR notify defence in writing that no requests will be made for third party disclosure

If the prosecution is to pursue third party disclosure, then the prosecution must serve a report in writing on the outcome of efforts to identify potentially disclosable materials held by third parties and any ongoing enquiries not yet completed. The same may be included in a Disclosure Management Document
Any disclosable third party disclosure shall be served on the defence
Prosecution to make any application required to the Family Court
Unless individual dates are provided it is ordered that the defence shall serve the following by:
Defence Statement to include particulars of alibi; and requests for disclosure, describing the material and explaining, by reference to the issues in the case, why it is disclosable
Response to prosecution Disclosure Management Document if served identifying by reference to the issues in the case any disputes as to reasonable lines of enquiry or levels of data extraction

Provide particulars of prosecution witnesses required to give live evidence; defence witnesses and interpreter requirements by using the CP Standard Witness Table or in the case of unrepresented defendants providing a paper Standard Witness Table

Response to Summary of Expert Conclusions (SFR1) stating which, if any, of the expert's conclusions are admitted as fact and where a conclusion is not admitted stating what are the disputed issues concerning that conclusion
Response to prosecution bad character notice(s)
Response to prosecution special measures application(s)
Special measures application for defendant or defence witnesses. Any reply from prosecution or other party to be served within 14 days
Defence expert evidence to be relied upon
Unless individual dates are provided it is ordered that the prosecution shall serve the following by:

Further disclosure of items required to be disclosed under CPIA resulting from or requested by the Defence Statement. (If the Defence Statement is served late the prosecution have a like period from service of the Defence Statement as between Stages 2 and 3 to serve further disclosure)

Further updated Disclosure Management Document. (If the Defence DMD response is served late the prosecution have a like period from service of the DMD Response as between Stages 2 and 3 to serve further disclosure)
Further evidence to be relied upon that could not be served by Stage 1
Forensic science statements (SFR2 or MG11) required as a result of the Defence response to a summary of conclusions (SFR1)
Live link or Remote link application(s) - If remote link is from abroad the application must identify any steps required or taken to comply with mutual co-operation obligations
Intermediary report(s) with draft specific Ground Rules if to be applied for
List of editing proposals to ABE interview recording
Unless individual dates are given it is ordered that the defence shall serve the following by:
Complaint about prosecution non-disclosure to comply with s.8 CPIA and CrimPR 15.5

Application(s) for witness summons for third party disclosure if the prosecution indicates at PTPH that it will not be pursuing any TPD issues OR any defendant is dissatisfied with the outcome of prosecution enquiries
List of editing proposals to ABE interview recording (if any) and response to prosecution proposals (if served)
S.100 or 101 bad character of non-defendant application. Any reply from prosecution or other party to be served within 14 days
S.41 Evidence of sexual behaviour application. Any reply from prosecution or other party to be served within 14 days
Intermediary report for defendant or defence witnesses with draft ground rules. Any reply from prosecution or other party to be served within 14 days
Live link or remote link application(s) - If remote link is from abroad the application must identify any steps required or taken to comply with mutual co-operation obligations
Defence expert evidence to be relied upon that could not be served by Stage 2

Prosecution to notify defence if the prosecution do OR do not intend to obtain medican report within 7 days or by:
If prosecution are to serve medical report then to be served by:
If prosecution are not to serve medical report then defence to serve any second medical report by:

subSections.heading: Pre-trial recorded cross-examination (s.28) - vulnerable witnesses - s.16 YJCEA
subSections.hintText: The judge being satisfied that the following witness(es) is/are eligible for assistance under s.16 of the YJCEA a s.28 direction is made that their ABE interviews shall stand as their evidence in chief and they shall be cross examined in advance of the trial

fields.label: The case is allocated to
fields.hintText: The future management of the case will be under the supervision of the trial judge

fields.label: s.4 Contempt of Court Act 1981 order has been made for the
Intermediary report(s) to be served by:
Ground Rules Form and any applications relevant to the witness to be served by
fields.hintText: Eg s.100 bad character; s.41 sexual behaviour; or s.8 non-disclosure

fields.label: Responses to above applications to be served by
s.28 directions and Ground Rules Hearing
Any intermediary relied on shall attend the Ground Rules Hearing
Date for witness to refresh their memory
fields.hintText: The officer in the case or another suitable police officer (or investigator equivalent) shall attend during the memory refreshing and make a note of any material comment by the witness

fields.label: The judge and advocates shall meet the witness on
The advocates are not to meet the witness without the judge

subSections.hintText: The judge being satisfied that the following witness(es) is/are eligible for assistance under s.17 of the YJCEA a s.28 direction is made that their ABE interviews shall stand as their evidence in chief and they shall be cross examined in advance of the trial

fields.label: The case is allocated to

Applications relevant to the witness to be served by
fields.hintText: Eg s.100 bad character; s.41 sexual behaviour; or s.8 non-disclosure

fields.label: Responses to above applications to be served by
The hearing may be vacated upon all parties informing the court CPO in writing that they are fully ready and no orders are required.

fields.hintText: The officer in the case or another suitable police officer (or investigator equivalent) shall attend during the memory refreshing and make a note of any material comment by the witness

subSections.heading: Pre-trial review - general
subSections.hintText: The PTR may be vacated if, when providing trial readiness information all parties confirm that they are fully trial ready and no orders are required.

subSections.heading: Ground rules and welfare and/or S.41 sexual behaviour and pre-trial review - (not s.28)
Trial preparation
subSections.hintText: These orders will only be required in more substantial cases

subMap.label: Witness Timetable for prosecution witnesses with copy to the Witness Service
Notice of objection or comment on the Opening Note; responses and requests for inclusion to the Draft agreed fact and jury bundle
Defence response to defendant's interview edits
Any defence response to Witness Timetable

subSections.heading: Standard orders for witnesses and defendants

values.item: 1. Where a defendant appears at PTPH by video link from custody without objection at the hearing the court makes a live link direction under s.57B Crime and Disorder Act 1998.
2. The witness requirements are as confirmed by the court on the Witness List and any special measures or orders endorsed shall apply.

3. If no Standard Witness Table information is served by a defendant, the served written statements of witnesses (compliant with s.9 CJA 1967 and with notice as required by CrimPR 16) not listed as required in the Witness Table at PTPH shall be admissible as evidence to the like extent as oral evidence to the like effect by that witness.

fields.label: Where Special measures are granted for the use of ABE interviews; live link or screens

values.item: 4. Where a witness has provided an ABE interview, the ABE interview as edited by agreement or by order of the court shall stand as that witness' evidence in chief unless otherwise ordered.

5. A witness whose ABE interview is relied on shall view that interview in the week preceding the trial in the presence of the officer in the case (or equivalent) or other suitable police officer (or investigator equivalent) who shall record any material comment the witness shall make and pass that record to the prosecutor.
6. Any preference between screens or live link shall be identified after a court visit and shall include the witness' reasons for the preference.
7. The attendance of any such witness at trial must be timetabled for the time when the witness is expected to commence examination.

fields.label: Young or vulnerable witnesses or defendants CrimPR 18 & 3.9(7)

values.item: 8. Young or vulnerable witnesses or defendants to whom an Advocates Gateway Toolkit or the ICCA 20 Principles of Questioning apply are to be examined and cross-examined in accordance with those principles unless those are superseded by specific ground rules.

fields.label: Where provision is made for a witness by remote link

values.item: 9. Particulars of the link must be provided not less than three weeks before trial - CrimPD 18.23-4.
10. Any party seeking to rely on a witness giving evidence from a place outside the jurisdiction must ensure that mutual assistance obligations are complied with in advance of the trial.

11. Expert witnesses of comparable disciplines must liaise and serve on the parties and the Court a statement of the points on which they agree and disagree with reasons no less than 14 days prior to the trial OR by such date as may be inserted here: 10 Mar 2021.

fields.label: Reason if judicial warnings not given
